name: Fractured Famous Children Online Quiz | Fractured People | 10 Questions

questions.correct: Macaulay Culkin & McCaulay Culkin &  McCauly Culkin
questions.explanation:
Macaulay Culkin & McCaulay Culkin &  McCauly Culkin.

	The Home Alone star was also terrific in My Girl. He married Rachel Miner at 17, but they've already split up. Macaulay has many siblings, most of whom are actors, too. Rory Culkin was fantastic in You Can Count on Me. Laura Linney played his mom, and she was nominated for an Academy Award.

Prince William.

	Poor guy lost his mum, Princess Diana, when he was a teen. As of November 2001, he's at St. Andrew's University in Scotland.

Elian Gonzalez.

	This poor little Cuban castaway lost his mother on the way to Florida from Cuba. He was dragged into a dreadful struggle between Cuban Americans and the Justice Department. Some say Elian's return to Cuba cost Al Gore the election and damaged former Attorney General Janet Reno's political career.

Harry Potter.

	Harry Potter, a student at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, may be the most famous fictional child in history. The Harry Potter books are by J.K. Rowling. They're great. I can't wait to see the movie, though I have a hard time believing it will be worthy of the books.

Ramona Quimby.

	A terrific, funny character created by children's author Beverly Cleary. Ramona has an older sister named Beezus, and a younger sister named Roberta--she's just born in the book I read.

Shirley Temple.

	She was a sweet, spunky little kid who tap-danced charmingly and sang 'On the Good Ship Lollipop' and 'Animal Crackers in My Soup.' I loved her in 'A Little Princess.' She grew up to be Shirley Temple Black, a politician and ambassador.

Chelsea Clinton.

	Sensible Chelsea seems to have survived the Monica scandal pretty well. She went to high school in Washington, D.C., received a Bachelor's degree in history from Stanford University, and went on to graduate school at Oxford. She hopes to obtain a Master's degree in International Relations.

Marcia Brady & Marsha Brady.

	She was played by Maureen McCormick, who's still acting.

Natalie Wood.

	Beautiful Natalie starred in the Christmas classic 'Miracle on 34th Street' when she was a child. As an adult she lit up the screen in 'Splendor in the Grass,' 'West Side Story,' and 'Love with a Proper Stranger.' She drowned in 1981.

Ron Howard.

	Ron Howard played Opie Taylor on the Andy Griffith Show from 1960-1968. In the 70s he starred in the movie and TV versions of 'American Graffiti.' Later he became a distinguished director. My favorite of his films is 'Apollo 13' with Tom Hanks. My least favorite is 'The Grinch.'
